BMC polls: Congress decides to go solo; Uddhav–Raj bonhomie strains MVA
description: The Congress party has announced it will contest the upcoming Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation (BMC) elections independently. This decision comes as Uddhav Thackeray's Shiv Sena (UBT) and Raj Thackeray's MNS appear to be aligning, potentially to protect the Thackeray political legacy. The MVA alliance, which includes Congress, faced a significant defeat in the 2024 Maharashtra Assembly elections.

title: T20 WC squad: 'Very happy' Ishan Kishan reacts to India recall as Gill misses out
description: Ishan Kishan expressed his delight after being selected for India's T20 World Cup 2026 squad, returning to the national side following a stellar Syed Mushtaq Ali Trophy campaign. Suryakumar Yadav will lead the 15-member team, with Shubman Gill notably excluded due to form and fitness concerns.

title: From insurance to SIPs to retirement: How Parliament’s Winter Session rewrote your financial future
description: Parliament has enacted sweeping financial reforms, including 100% foreign ownership in insurance and pension firms, to boost domestic investment amidst global trade tensions. These changes aim to lower costs for consumers, improve product offerings, and channel capital into India's growth story, promising a more competitive and efficient financial landscape.

title: T20 World Cup squad: Captain Suryakumar speaks up on his form; remarks after Gill's omission
description: Ahead of the T20 World Cup, selectors dropped Shubman Gill, prioritizing impact players and quick starts. Ishan Kishan and Rinku Singh return, while captain Suryakumar Yadav, despite recent lean form, expressed confidence in his batting resurgence. The team aims for stronger performances from its leader as they prepare to defend their title.

‘Global pecking order has changed’: Jaishankar jibes Western economic model
description: EAM S Jaishankar has pointed towards a significant shift in the global economic and political hierarchy, reflecting upon India's advantage in human resources as developed nations face demographic challenges. He emphasized that India is becoming a driver of the global workforce, creating new responsibilities for governments in managing cross-border mobility and citizen welfare.

title: UP shocker: Teen boy ‘slammed on floor’ by hospital staff after kin refuse to pay bribe
description: A 14-day-old infant's body was exhumed in Pilibhit following allegations of deliberate harm by hospital staff over an unpaid bribe. Parents claim the child was dropped, while hospital officials deny this, stating a vacuum extraction led to swelling mistaken for injury. The father alleges threats after reporting the incident, prompting a magistrate-ordered autopsy for clarity.

title: Jharkhand horror: Drunk army jawan 'rapes' woman inside train; accused arrested
description: An Army jawan on duty was arrested in Ranchi for allegedly raping a 22-year-old woman at Tatisilwai Railway Station. The 42-year-old soldier, reportedly inebriated, took the woman to an empty train coach and committed the assault. He was apprehended after bystanders raised an alarm.

'Attack on interests of poor': Sonia Gandhi slams PM Modi over VB-G RAM G Bill
description: Congress leader Sonia Gandhi has strongly criticized Prime Minister Narendra Modi's government. She claims the new VB-G RAM G Bill replaces MGNREGA and harms the poor. The government states the new law improves upon MGNREGA, which it says was plagued by corruption. The opposition protested the bill's passage in Parliament.

title: 'Mistaken for Bangladeshi national': Dalit man beaten to death in Kerala; probe under way
description: A Dalit migrant worker from Chhattisgarh, Ramnarayan Baghel, was tragically beaten to death in Kerala's Palakkad district. Initial reports suggest he was mistaken for a Bangladeshi national and possibly a thief after a local incident. Five arrests have been made as police investigate the brutal mob violence that has left his family devastated and sparked fear among migrant communities.

description: A Delhi court on Saturday ordered the release of Christian Michel James from custody in the Augusta Westland money laundering case, as he has served the maximum statutory sentence. While released from the PMLA case, Michel will remain in custody for the related CBI case.

description: A Hindu garment worker named Dipu Chandra Das was brutally killed by a mob in Bangladesh. He was accused of blasphemy. The incident occurred in Bhaluka, Mymensingh. Authorities have arrested seven individuals in connection with the lynching. This event has raised serious concerns about the safety of religious minorities in the country.

description: Australia has enacted a law prohibiting social media use for those under 16, a move sparking global debate. While parents largely support it, youth oppose it. India faces similar discussions, with challenges in implementing a ban due to its vast population and digital integration.

description: Shubman Gill has been excluded from India's T20 World Cup squad due to his recent lack of form. Axar Patel has been appointed vice-captain, while Ishan Kishan returns as the second wicketkeeper and reserve opener. Rinku Singh is back as the designated finisher.

The spy thriller is projected to surpass Rs. 500 crore by Saturday, even amidst competition from 'Avatar: Fire and Ash'. The film has shown impressive growth since its massive opening, based on true incidents.

title: ‘You are wrong’: Former ASML engineer build EUV machine; contradicts CEO’s timeline
description: China has reportedly built a working prototype of an advanced chip-making machine, defying Western predictions.  Former ASML engineers are said to be behind the project, which aims for semiconductor independence. This development, a six-year government initiative, could significantly alter global chip supply chains, challenging ASML's monopoly on crucial EUV technology.

Daily vehicle influx exceeds 1,000, causing significant congestion on key routes. Authorities are prioritizing traffic management with increased police deployment and a planned traffic strategy.

Anthony Joshua net worth 2025: Boxing earnings, career and Jake Paul fight payday
description: Anthony Joshua's net worth is estimated at £195 million in 2025, with the majority earned from boxing purses. He also generates significant income from endorsements and property investments. Joshua is set to earn a guaranteed £70 million from his upcoming fight against Jake Paul, a professionally sanctioned eight-round heavyweight bout.

title: Chat cart: When your tandoori naan & tikka aren’t smoky, but everything else is
description: Winters in Delhi once meant a sensory delight of seasonal foods, from makke ki roti to halwa. However, recent years have brought deadly pollution, replacing aromatic food whiffs with the smell of burning and health concerns. Despite this, foodies still brave the smog to savor traditional street food, though conversations now revolve around pollution and sore throats.

title: 'Rs 30 lakh to take image with Messi’: Kolkata police raid organiser Satadru Dutta’s house
description: Authorities investigating the Lionel Messi event's mismanagement raided chief organizer Satadru Dutta's home, uncovering a lavish residence with a pool and soccer ground. The probe has broadened beyond crowd control to suspected Rs 100 crore financial irregularities, including unaccounted cash for photos with Messi and opaque ticket sales, suggesting deliberate financial impropriety.

title: Court will always lean towards animals who suffer silently: Supreme Court
description: The Supreme Court has signaled its strong inclination to protect elephants, stating it will always favor animals whose migration paths are obstructed by commercial tourism. This stance emerged during hearings concerning wildlife resorts in Tamil Nadu's Sigur Plateau elephant corridor. The court emphasized that any doubt regarding benefit should go to the silent victims of development.

title: Maharashtra horror: Nurse gang-raped after knocking on wrong hotel room; 3 accused arrested
description: A 30-year-old nurse was allegedly gang-raped by three men in a hotel room in Chhatrapati Sambhajinagar after she mistakenly knocked on their door. The accused, including two recovery agents and an MBA student, were arrested and remanded in police custody. The victim had gone to meet a friend for financial assistance when the incident occurred.

title: Goa: 18 months after NGT order, Curlies sealed for violations
Quote of the day by Sigmund Freud: 'A man should not strive to eliminate…'
description: Famous Austrian neurologist Sigmund Freud completely changed the way we look at the human mind by discovering psychoanalysis. It was a talking therapy for mental issues rooted in unconscious thoughts which people fail to realize and accept.  His  famous book "Interpretation of Dreams" said that dreams reveal hidden desires of human beings.

title: Sivakarthikeyan moves Madras high court over Rs 15 cr payment dispute
description: Actor Sivakarthikeyan has found himself in a legal battle with Studio Green Films, as he files a case in the Madras High Court for Rs 15 crore in outstanding payments for the film 'Mr. Local'.

title: Google founder’s prediction 25-yrs ago is now company’s reality: What he said about AI
description: A resurfaced 2000 video shows Google co-founder Larry Page accurately predicting the future of AI-driven search. He envisioned an "ultimate search engine" that would understand user intent and provide direct answers, a capability now realized by Gemini models. Page acknowledged the company was far from this goal then but was committed to incremental progress, leveraging vast data and computational resources.

title: Maple Leafs fans on edge as Auston Matthews trade talks heat up
description: Maple Leafs captain Auston Matthews is facing scrutiny as his scoring has slowed. This has sparked discussions about his future with the team. Toronto management must navigate this delicate situation. The coming months will be crucial for both Matthews and the Maple Leafs' legacy. The team aims for immediate success.

title: Zuckerberg's 'highest-paid' employee is reportedly unhappy with his Boss - What he said
description: Meta's $14.8 billion investment in Scale AI and the integration of its CEO, Alexandr Wang, into a new "superintelligence" lab are reportedly facing internal friction. Wang allegedly finds Mark Zuckerberg's micromanagement "suffocating," while some staff question Wang's experience. This shift also clashes with Meta's open-source AI philosophy, leading to executive departures.
